title: 24 essays on Kathy Acker, Octavia Butler, Angela Carter
description:
ANGELA CARTER
01. Isn&#039;t It Romantic?: Angela Carter&#039;s Bloody Revision of the Romantic Aesthetic in "The Erl-King" 
02. The Modern English Visionary: Peter Ackroyd&#039;s "Hawksmoor" and Angela Carter&#039;s "The Passion of New Eve"
03. Intersexions: Gender Metamorphosis in Angela Carter&#039;s The Passion of New Eve and Lois Gould&#039;s A Sea-Change
04. Return of the Century: Time, Modernity, and the End of History in Angela Carter&#039;s &#039;Nights at the Circus&#039;
05. Angela Carter&#039;s "Nights at the Circus:" An Engaged Feminism via Subversive Postmodern Strategies
06. Oral Sex: Vampiric Transgression and the Writing of Angela Carter
07. Pornography, Fairy Tales, and Feminism: Angela Carter&#039;s "The Bloody Chamber"
KATHY ACKER
08. The Geography of Enunciation: Hysterical Pastiche in Kathy Acker&#039;s Fiction
09. Blood Money: Sovereignty and Exchange

OCTAVIA BUTLER

20. Octavia Butler and the Black Science-Fiction Heroine
21. Radio Imagination: Octavia Butler on the Poetics of Narrative Embodiment
22. Connections, Links, and Extended Networks: Patterns in Octavia Butler&#039;s Science
23. The Competing Demands of Community Survival and Self-Preservation in Octavia Butler&#039;s "Kindred"
24. Taking Out The Trash: Octavia E. Butler&#039;s "Wild Seed" and the Feminist Voice in American SF
